title.narrative: 3.1: PUBLIC SECTOR CAPACITY TO MANAGE EVIDENCE AND RESOURCES ON DEPRIVATIONS

description.narrative: 3.1: Enhanced public sector capacity to generate, analyse, monitor and report evidence and associated resources on the multi- deprivation situation of women and children., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Strengthening capacities for decentralized convergent social services

related-activity.ref: 6810/A0/07/883 STRENGTHENING CAPACITIES FOR DECENTRALIZED CONVERGENT SOCIAL SERVICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.1: Enhanced public sector capacity to generate, analyse, monitor and report evidence and associated resources on the multi-deprivation situation of women and children.

description.narrative: National and local governments technically and financially supported on addressing poverty through social protection programmes. Over 40,000 children of over 20,000 households from Moxico, Bie, Uige and Luanda Provinces are enrolled in social protection programmes, piloted under the decentralization of the social services at municipal level, with the direct engagement of municipal administrations and provincial governments.A new measure of child monetary poverty is published by the Institute for National Statistics. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
